intro: Thuraria chilensis, commonly known as the Chilean thuraria, is a flowering plant native to southern South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its umbellate inflorescence. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to temperate climates. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, while its small white or greenish flowers bloom in clusters. Thuraria chilensis is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
